sentence.idiomatic: Although the lighting is poor here, but the scenery is very beautiful.
The lighting is a little bit dim to take the photo here--it might not turn out too well.
This angle is not good, and it's very dark. It might be because of poor lighting.
Hurry up and get on the bus everyone--don't dillydally.
How come you're dawdling so much? Everyone is waiting for you.
She always dawdles. Others can finish it in an hour, but she needs a whole day.
On such a hot day what is everyone doing so crammed together?
I'm squished here, could you lean to the other way a little?
Should I stop the car on the left or on the right?
The people in the front please squat down, otherwise we can't see the people behind you.
This kid--as soon as you won't buy him a toy he will squat on the floor and refuse to leave.
Yesterday I saw him squatting in the corner all alone, it was quite sad.
When I walk my feet always tilt out to the sides.
You two--tilt your faces to the center a little.
I leaned my body into hers, and she took off.
It was obviously him that did this, however he won't admit it.
Why didn't you tell everyone? Clearly you knew the true situation long ago.
I definitely put it into the bag, how could it have disappeared?
Playing games wastes too much time, so I never play.
I posed for so long, and in the end the camera broke. What a waste of my emotions.
He has such a nice sports car and doesn't drive it. What a waste of resources.
Be quiet. Don't disturb the guest's rest.
Constantly being in a bad mood will affect your health.
Due to the affect cause by typhoon, some flights are delayed.
Wow! It's so beautiful here. Let's take a group photo together, everyone. Stand over there... right, right. Just there.
But the light is poor here. Maybe we better choose another place. How about here?
The scenery isn't as beautiful there.
It's pretty nice too. Just stand here. Come on, everyone go stand over there. Quickly! Don't dawdle.
Can you get that many people in the photo?
Yes, but you have to stay a little closer in. Come on, everybody squeeze in for a little while. Still no good, everyone needs to squeeze a little closer.
I still can't get it like this. Or, how about we make two rows.

Good idea. OK, the tall people stand in the back. The people in the front can squat a little. Right, this way we can see everyone's faces. Hey, what's with everyone being so serious? Smile a little, everyone. Smile!
We're so tired from squatting. Hurry up and take the picture!
Almost ready. Hey you guys, stop making the peace sign with your fingers, everyone's always doing that. It's so idiotic. Act natural. Turn your faces to the middle a little.
You're so demanding--you're acting like a professional photographer.
Yes but it's all to make you look more beautiful in the photo, right? All right, I'll count to three and everyone say ``eggplant." One, two, three.
Eggplant!
Huh? How come the flash didn't go off? Let's take another!
Didn't go off? I turned it on, for sure. Let me see.
Did you do something wrong? You really wasted everyone's emotion. Hurry up, we're getting in people's way.
OK. Come on, everyone, look at me. One, two, three, ``eggplant!"
Eggplant!
